title: Stevo Glogovac
text:
Stevan "Stevo" Glogovac (<a href="Serbian%20Cyrillic">Serbian Cyrillic</a>: Стеван "Стево" Глоговац ; born January 9, 1973) is a former <a href="Serbs%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Bosnian Serb</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and currently a manager.
Playing career.
Club.
Born in <a href="Bile%C4%87a">Bileća</a>, <a href="SR%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">SR Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>, he made his debut for local club FK Hercegovac Bileća in 1990. Due to the beginning of the Bosnian War, he moved to Serbia where he started playing in <a href="FK%20Zvezdara">FK Zvezdara</a>. In 1997, he moved to the <a href="First%20League%20of%20FR%20Yugoslavia">First League of FR Yugoslavia</a> club <a href="FK%20Rad">FK Rad</a> where his good exhibitions made him make a move to the great 1991 European and World Champions <a href="Red%20Star%20Belgrade">Red Star Belgrade</a> winning two Championships, in 1999/2000 and 2000/2001 seasons, and two national Cups, in 2000 and 2002. In 2002, he went to <a href="Russia">Russia</a> and played in <a href="Anzhi%20Makhachkala">Anzhi Makhachkala</a> but, in January 2003, he was back to Serbia, this time to play <a href="FK%20Zemun">FK Zemun</a>. After two seasons there, he moved, in January 2006, to <a href="FK%20Be%C5%BEanija">FK Bežanija</a>. In summer 2007 he signed with another Belgrade based club <a href="FK%20Vo%C5%BEdovac">FK Voždovac</a> where he played his last season before retirement.
Coaching career.
He started coaching professionally <a href="Serbian%20League%20Belgrade">Serbian league</a> club <a href="FK%20Palilulac">FK Palilulac</a> in 2009, by the beginning of 2010 he has left club, due to many problems, both in squad and management.
Private life.
Stevo's older brother <a href="Dragan%20Glogovac">Dragan</a> was also a professional footballer.
